SEARCH
Package BusinessLogic

Class OrderBLL

java.lang.Object
BusinessLogic.validators.Validation<Orders>
BusinessLogic.OrderBLL
public class OrderBLL extends Validation<Orders>
The OrderBLL class provides the business logic for processing orders. It extends Validation to inherit validation functionality for Orders, and it interacts with OrderDAO and ProductDAO for database operations.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    OrderBLL()
    Constructs a new OrderBLL instance and initializes the data access objects for orders and products.

  • Method Details

    • orderTable

      public Map.Entry<Object[][],ArrayList<String>> orderTable()
      Retrieves a table-form representation of orders.
      Returns:
      a Map.Entry where the key is a two-dimensional object array representing the bill records, and the value is an ArrayList of column names.

    • addOrder

      public Map.Entry<Integer,ArrayList<Object>> addOrder(int id_client, int id_product, double price_product, int quantity_product, int quantity_demanded)
      Adds an order by processing the requested product quantity and updating the product inventory.
      Parameters:
      id_client - the ID of the client placing the order.
      id_product - the ID of the product to be ordered.
      price_product - the price per unit of the product.
      quantity_product - the total quantity available of the product.
      quantity_demanded - the quantity of the product requested in this order.
      Returns:
      a Map.Entry where the key is the remaining product quantity after processing the order, and the value is an ArrayList containing order details: order ID, client ID, product ID, ordered quantity, and the computed total price.
      Throws:
      InputMismatchException - if the available quantity is insufficient or if the insertion fails.

    • deleteOrder

      public boolean deleteOrder(int id)
      Deletes an order from the database.
      Parameters:
      id - the unique identifier of the order to delete.
      Returns:
      true if the order was successfully deleted false otherwise.
